meanings.definition: To make or become black or dark in color.
meanings.sent1: The sun nigrified the once bright curtains.
meanings.sent2: The fire nigrified the wood, turning it into charcoal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child nigrified his face with mud for a prank.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds nigrified the sky, signaling an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The ink nigrified the paper, leaving a permanent mark.

meanings.definition: To darken or stain with black or dark color.
meanings.sent1: The spilled ink nigrified the pristine white tablecloth.
meanings.sent2: The artist nigrified the canvas with bold strokes of black paint.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy nigrified the carpet with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of the tree nigrified the grass beneath it.
meanings.sent5: The night slowly nigrified the sky, revealing the stars.
